definition: to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: The party tonight was crowded with wits and beauties.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的舞會才子佳人雲集。

sentences.english: Business people from all over the world meet in Guangzhou at this event, exchanging business information and developing friendships.
sentences.chinese: 來自世界各地的客商雲集廣州，互通商情，增進友誼。

sentences.english: The star-studded study appears in the Journal of Human Capital.
sentences.chinese: 這項衆星雲集的研究成果發表在《人力資本》期刊上。

sentences.english: I im the star in the northern sky.
sentences.chinese: 在北部空中雲集成小星虛度。

sentences.english: Some of the best brains in the city are here tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我市一些精英人物將在這裏雲集。

sentences.english: Magician means a changeable stage full of masters.
sentences.chinese: 其意爲變幻莫測，高手雲集的舞臺。

sentences.english: Shanghai IFC Mall will offer a selection of international retailers.
sentences.chinese: 上海國金中心商場將雲集世界著名品牌。

sentences.english: Worshipers flock there, and so do many tourists and sightseers.
sentences.chinese: 香客雲集，還有許多遊客。

sentences.english: AMERICA'S capital, filled with politicos and pundits, is a noisy place.
sentences.chinese: 美國首都政客學者雲集，熱鬧非凡。

sentences.english: The Luo Fu International Poetry Festival opened in Hengnan county of Hengyang City, Hunan Province.
sentences.chinese: 洛夫國際詩歌節在湖南衡南縣城雲集開幕。

sentences.english: Yangshuo, which is known as the miniature of the world, gathered foreigners from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 這裏老外雲集，可以說是一個地道的地球村的縮影。

sentences.english: The movie's production team for "Oh My God" is weirdly star-studded.
sentences.chinese: 電影《從天兒降》的製作團隊可謂是衆星雲集。

sentences.english: The city is swarmed with tourists.
The movie with an all-star cast is expected to set a new box office record.
sentences.chinese: 這部明星雲集的電影預計將創下新的票房紀錄。

sentences.english: Another highlight of the movie is its all-star cast.
sentences.chinese: 該片的另一個焦點在於明星雲集的演員陣容。

sentences.english: Many major medias were at the briefing and lots of questions were asked.
sentences.chinese: 各大媒體雲集吹風會，紛紛提問。

definition: to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
convergence/to come together
pageant/distinguished meeting
(at an) international level
collecting together (of distinguished people or exquisite objects)/to gather/to assemble
numerous
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
to get together all at once
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
domestic and international/at home and abroad
person of outstanding talent
to open (a conference)/to inaugurate
at sb's invitation/on invitation
